message_1: Using temporal logic, if an event A happens at time t=5 and an event B happens at time t=10, create a logical formula that returns "true" if event B happened after event A and "false" if event B happened before or at the same time as event A.
message_2:
Let's represent the occurrence of event A at time t=5 as A(5) and the occurrence of event B at time t=10 as B(10). We want to create a logical formula that returns "true" if B(10) happened after A(5) and "false" otherwise.

The logical formula can be represented as:

B(t2) ∧ A(t1) → (t2 > t1)

In this formula, B(t2) represents the occurrence of event B at time t2, A(t1) represents the occurrence of event A at time t1, and (t2 > t1) checks if event B happened after event A.

Now, we can plug in the given values of t1 = 5 and t2 = 10:

B(10) ∧ A(5) → (10 > 5)

Since 10 > 5, the formula evaluates to "true", indicating that event B happened after event A.
